original_title: Sri Lanka to discuss US$200mn World Bank loan for welfare
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers had given approval for talks with World Bank to borrow 200 million US dollars for a welfare benefits, Trade Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.
A social safety net is a priority initiative under an International Monetary Fund backed program, he said.

Sri Lanka is planning to target welfare the most needed recipients, and help them graduate under a strong social safety net, according to a proposal submitted by President Ranil Wickremesinghe has Finance Minister, a statement said.
Releated Sri Lanka to borrow $150mn from World Bank for financial safety net
A 150 million US dollar credit from World Bank is also being negotiated for the financial sector. (Colombo/May09/2023)
